We are developing Documment management application (lot of money is on table).
And when we connecto to our server using IE 6.0.26 everything works fine.
But on machines using IE 6.0.28, IE kills all our session variables.
We are using iframes in project. I even try to write a simple application 
without iframes which just set session variable and then try to read them with 
other servlet, and when I do that it does the same thing (HTTP status 500 
because our session variable is Null in second (receaving) servlet).
I would send you application but it is based on ORACLE database where I can't
grant you any access, sorry.
If I don't find a soluttion for that problem until 8th october I'll have to 
change web server technology.
creator: kbicanic@ekonerg.hr

text:
I don't know what led you to believe that Jakarta were a consulting organization
with a 48 hours response time. BZ is made to report demonstrable bugs (ie, you
need to explain clearly where the problem is if it's simple, or produce a small
test case). Here, your problem may have a number of causes (IE bug, bug in your
code, bug in Tomcat). You should post on tomcat-user to get insight from other
users. Maybe they would have clues about your particular version of IE (you need
to give the last numbers in the version string, the first are useful also, but
are common between a lot of minor versions).

BTW, this kind of argument is really lame and better suited to "pressure"
proprietary software developers: "If I don't find a soluttion for that problem
until 8th october I'll have to change web server technology". I think I don't
care. It's not like you're writing me a check, otherwise, right ? ;-)
creator: remm@apache.org
william.barker@wilshire.com
text:
I'm very sorry that you have choosen to leave Tomcat for another web-app 
technology.

Before you go, I'd like to add some remarks.  It seems that your problems are 
related to MSIE's Cookie policies.  It is relativly easy to write a Servlet 
that will confirm to MSIE that your site conforms to what they want you to 
say.  Alterntivly, look into 'jakarta-struts' (or alternatives) to allow your 
webapp to continue to function without Cookies.

creator: william.barker@wilshire.com
